description: Hosted by Federico Viticci and Fraser Speirs, Canvas is a podcast all about mobile productivity. Armed with iOS, Federico and Fraser will be walking through workflows, exploring the best apps for the iPad and iPhone and helping users solve problems. Hosted by Federico Viticci and Fraser Speirs.
title: Canvas

episodes.title: 77: Future of iPad - Ecosystem
episodes.description: In this, final, episode of Canvas, Fraser and Federico look into the future of the iPad ecosystem.

episodes.title: 76: Future of iPad - Automation
episodes.description: Fraser and Federico open with an important announcement about the future of Canvas, then speculate on how iOS automation might move forward in the future.

episodes.title: 75: Future of iPad - The Cloud
episodes.description: In this episode on the future of the iPad, Fraser and Federico take a look at cloud services - both Apple's and third parties.

episodes.title: 74: Future of iPad - Hardware
episodes.description: In this post-event episode, Federico shares his impressions of the new 3rd generation iPad Pro and we look to the future of iPad hardware.

episodes.title: 73: Future of iPad - Software
episodes.description: In this forward-looking episode, Federico and Fraser try to imagine what the future of the iPad might be, with particular consideration of the software it runs.

episodes.title: 72: Fraser Goes to the Dark Side
episodes.description: In a surprising turn of events, Fraser buys an Android phone and Federico demands to know why.

episodes.title: 71: Shortcuts, Shortcuts or Shortcuts?
episodes.description: This week, Federico spends a quarter of the show saying "Shortcuts", Fraser invents a morse code Shortcut and OpenDoc is referenced in the passing.

episodes.title: 70: Task Managers in 2018
episodes.description: This week, Fraser and Federico take a look at the "Big Four" task managers on iOS - Things, OmniFocus, Todoist and Apple Reminders - and consider how the iOS ecosystem has changed since the early days.

episodes.title: 69: Getting Ready for iOS 12
episodes.description: This week, Federico leads us through an exploration of the new features coming (soon!) in iOS 12.

episodes.title: 68: Cloud Storage in 2018
episodes.description: Fraser is joined by David Chartier for a wide-ranging discussion on the state of cloud storage in 2018 and its impact on our lives.

episodes.title: 66: Living the Google Lifestyle on iOS
episodes.description: This week Fraser walks through the details of living the Google Lifestyle on iOS.

episodes.title: 65: Hands-On with the Shortcuts App
episodes.description: Federico is joined by Jason Snell to talk about Shortcuts.

episodes.title: 64: Summer Travel with iOS
episodes.description: Appropriately for the topic, Federico is away so Fraser is joined by Bradley Chambers to share tips and tricks for managing summer travel with iOS.

episodes.title: 63: iOS 12 First Impressions
episodes.description: Fraser and Federico have been living on the early betas of iOS 12 for a couple of weeks now and they really like it.

episodes.title: 62: WWDC 2018 with David Chartier
episodes.description: With Federico at WWDC, Fraser is joined by David Chartier to evaluate the announcements of Apple's Keynote.

episodes.title: 61: Parental Controls
episodes.description: In this solo episode, Fraser takes you through four techniques for restricting the function of an iOS device in different scenarios.

episodes.title: 60: Watching TV on iOS
episodes.description: Turns outâ„¢ that iOS was for content consumption all along! This week, Fraser and Federico look at ways to watch TV and video content on iOS.

episodes.title: 59: Keeping Track of the Weather
episodes.description: In this episode, Fraser and Federico chat about the weather and how to keep an eye on it digitally through iOS.

episodes.title: 58: The Multi-Pad Lifestyle, with Myke Hurley
episodes.description: Myke Hurley joins the show to discuss why and how he uses multiple iPads for his work.

episodes.title: 57: Apple Education Event 2018
episodes.description: On March 27th, Apple held its 2018 Education Event showcasing the 6th Generation iPad and various new education apps and features. We dig into these announcements and look at iOS' role in education.

episodes.title: 56: eBooks on iOS
episodes.description: In this episode, Federico and Fraser look at your options for reading and creating eBooks on iOS. From mainstream apps like iBooks and Kindle to Marvin, Hyphen and creation tools like Book Creator, we cover it all.

episodes.title: 55: Getting the Most out of Find My Friends
episodes.description: This week, Fraser leads us on a deep-dive into the feature set of Find My Friends, the built-in location sharing app in iOS.

episodes.title: 54: Managing Your Smart Home from iOS
episodes.description: This week, Federico schools Fraser in the ways of Apple HomeKit and HomeKit compatible accessories.

episodes.title: 53: Remote Screens on iOS
episodes.description: This week, Federico and Fraser continue discussing techniques for connecting to remote computers using screen-sharing protocols like VNC.

episodes.title: 52: SSH from iOS
episodes.description: This week we dive into a nerdy topic: working with SSH connections on iOS.

episodes.title: 51: Apple Watch
episodes.description: With Christmas just around the corner, we bet some listeners might be the new owners of a shiny Apple Watch quite soon. Here are our favourite apps and tips!

episodes.title: 50: The Things We Carry
episodes.description: For our 50th episode, we take a look at the outside of our iPads instead of the inside. Fraser and Federico open up their kit bags and show what they carry alongside their iPads.

episodes.title: 49: Long-Form Editors - Honourable Mentions
episodes.description: In this episode, we wrap up our look at long-form editors with a look at the honourable mentions for other interesting apps on iOS.

episodes.title: 48: Long-form Writing in Scrivener
episodes.description: We continue with our mini-series on long-form writing apps with a look at Scrivener.

episodes.title: 47: Long-form Writing in Ulysses
episodes.description: In this first episode of a mini-series on long-form writing on iOS, Fraser and Federico go deep on one of their favourite applications: Ulysses.

episodes.title: 46: Versions
episodes.description: Making, accessing and using versions of files is something that has been built into some iOS apps for a while now but few know how to access the feature.

episodes.title: 45: Files and File Providers in iOS 11
episodes.description: With iOS 11 released, apps are starting to receive updates to be compatible with features like the new Files app. In this episode, Fraser and Federico dig into whatâ€™s possible for cloud storage.

episodes.title: 44: Getting Ready for iOS 11
episodes.description: In this solo episode, Fraser shares information about iOS storage management, backup and OS updating in preparation for iOS 11.

episodes.title: 43: iOS 11 Notes
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take a look at the changes coming to one of the most-used applications in iOS: Apple Notes.

episodes.title: 42: iOS 11 - Multitasking
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico resolve their differences over another major iOS 11 feature: Multitasking.

episodes.title: 41: iOS 11 - Drag and Drop
episodes.description: In this episode, Fraser and Federico dive deep on the topic of Drag and Drop in iOS 11.

episodes.title: 40: Mind Mapping
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico really explore the space looking at Mind Mapping tools on iOS.

episodes.title: 39: Everyone Can Code on iPad
episodes.description: This week Fraser flies the show solo and brings an update on programming on iOS by going into detail on Appleâ€™s Everyone Can Code initiative.

episodes.title: 38: 21 Days Later
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico reflect on a couple of weeks of intensive use of iOS 11.

episodes.title: 37: WWDC 2017 with Tom Bridge
episodes.description: This week, we go in-depth on the iOS-related announcements from WWDC 2017.

episodes.title: 36: Wishes for iOS 11
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico welcome special guest Merlin Mann to discuss opportunities for improvements that may - or may not - arrive in iOS 11.

episodes.title: 35: Outlining
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico look at two options for outlining on iOS.

episodes.title: 34: Password Managers
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico look at another aspect of personal security on iOS: password managers.

episodes.title: 33: iOS Device Security
episodes.description: This week, inspired by true events, Fraser and Federico look at the user-facing security technologies available in iOS.

episodes.title: 32: iWork 3.1 Update and Apple Classroom
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico dig into the changes in Apple's recent iWork 3.1 update and explore Apple Classroom 2.0.

episodes.title: 31: Note Taking with Apple Pencil
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take their Apple Pencils in hand and share some notes on taking notes with the iPad Pro.

episodes.title: 30: The Share Sheet
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico tackle a core part of iOS: the Share Sheet.

episodes.title: 29: Workflow - Magic Variables
episodes.description: In this episode, Fraser and Federico update the Workflow series for the major new feature that debuted in Workflow 1.7 - Magic Variables.

episodes.title: 28: Read Later Services
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico change gears and focus on Read Later services.

episodes.title: 27: Advanced Workflow Programming Part 2
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico close out the Workflow programming series with some of the more advanced techniques in Workflow programming.

episodes.title: 26: Advanced Workflow Programming
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take a look at some of the advanced programming structures in Workflow.

episodes.title: 25: Workflow - Web APIs
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico dive into Web service API programming in Workflow.

episodes.title: 24: Workflow - Third Party Applications
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico continue the Workflow series by looking at integrating Workflow with third-party apps.

episodes.title: 23: Workflow - Variables and Built-in Actions
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico continue the Workflow series with a look at how to use Variables and Workflow's built-in actions.

episodes.title: 22: Workflow - The Basics
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico begin a multi-part series on the iOS automation app Workflow.

episodes.title: 21: Office and Google Docs
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico complete the set and talk about Microsoft Office and Google Docs on iOS.

episodes.title: 20: iWork 3.0
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take a tour of iWork 3.0.

episodes.title: 19: iOS 10
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico discuss - what else? - iOS 10.

episodes.title: 18: Watching Video on iOS
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take a look at a leisure activity on iOS: watching video.

episodes.title: 17: 2Do with Ben Brooks
episodes.description: This week Fraser talks with Ben Brooks about the third major task manager on iOS, 2Do.

episodes.title: 16: Task Management Part 2
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take another pass at managing tasks on iOS, this time looking at implementing Getting Things Done with OmniFocus on iOS.

episodes.title: 15: Task Management Part 1
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico take a pass at task management on iOS. This is another area of productivity where iOS is very well served for options.

episodes.title: 14: Calendars
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico dive into managing your calendar on iOS.

episodes.title: 13: Weird iOS
episodes.description: This week Fraser is joined by writer David Chartier to explore some of the stranger things you can do with iOS.

episodes.title: 12: Programming on iOS
episodes.description: The mission of Canvas has always been to illuminate the parts of iOS that people think can't be done. In that spirit, this week Fraser and Federico dig into how to program on iOS.

episodes.title: 11: Travelling with iOS
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico discuss travelling with iOS devices.

episodes.title: 10: Third Party Email Clients
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico (particularly Federico) drop serious knowledge on 3rd party iOS mail clients.

episodes.title: 9: Presenting with iOS
episodes.description: This week Fraser flies the show solo to talk about his experience in creating, delivering and sharing presentations with iOS.

episodes.title: 8: Apple Mail
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico tackle email on iOS using everyone's default client Apple Mail.

episodes.title: 7: Scanning with iOS Devices
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico investigate the rich world of camera-based scanners on iOS.

episodes.title: 6: Creating and Managing PDFs
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico talk about generating, managing and annotating PDF files on iOS.

episodes.title: 5: Typing
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico dig into how to be more efficient with typing and text entry on iOS.

episodes.title: 4: Photo Editing
episodes.description: This week Fraser and Federico go in-depth on serious photo editing on iOS.

episodes.title: 3: Photo Management
episodes.description:
Federico and Fraser go in-depth on modern photo management on iOS devices.

Photo management is traditionally one of the trickier areas to deal with in an iOS-only lifestyle. This week, we focus on the modern era of photo management by looking in-depth at iCloud Photo Library, which can minimise or even eliminate many of the difficulties in handling a large library of photos. We also discuss apps that work well with iCloud Photo Library and tell you how to spot ones that don't.

episodes.title: 2: Document Providers
episodes.description: Federico and Fraser go in-depth on the Document Picker and Document Provider system in iOS 9.

episodes.title: 1: Download and Upload Files
episodes.description: In this initial episode of Canvas, Federico and Fraser discuss the available tools and techniques for downloading files from the web and uploading files back to websites. This is a task that was difficult-to-impossible on iOS before iOS 9 was released but is now easy.
